    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int daysInInterval()
      // This method calculates the number of days in the given interval ( used for price calculation ) // In other words it calculates the number of days from the start date to the end date [ up to 1 day error margin in a specific case ] // If the reserved period goes into the next year, and lasts until after the whole February, there is a possibility that price wont be calculated properly ( because of days in February )
      int daysInMonth(int month)
      // Returns the number of days in the given month
      int daysTilMonthEnd(int month, int day)
      // Calculates how many days are left until the end of the month ( in the given month from the starting date )
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      boolean isAfter(MyDate date)
      // Same thing as isBefore, just for checking if the certain date is after, suited for out problem ofc // Anyhow I think its self-explanatory, there should be a diagram somewhere explaining graphically the position of end and start nodes
      boolean isBefore(MyDate date)
      // Standard isBeofre method, similar to one used during classes // It is tailored to suit our needs, see start - end node diagrams / sketches for more details
      java.lang.String nowEndDateToString() 
      MyDate nowSet()
      // This method sets the start day to the current system date
      java.lang.String nowStartDateToString() 
      void setEndDay(int endDay) 
      void setEndMonth(int endMonth) 
      void setEndYear(int endYear)

      • isAfter

        public boolean isAfter(MyDate date)
        // Same thing as isBefore, just for checking if the certain date is after, suited for out problem ofc // Anyhow I think its self-explanatory, there should be a diagram somewhere explaining graphically the position of end and start nodes
        Parameters:
        date - that is compared
        Returns:
        true or false value, depending if the date is after or not

      • daysInInterval

        public int daysInInterval()
        // This method calculates the number of days in the given interval ( used for price calculation ) // In other words it calculates the number of days from the start date to the end date [ up to 1 day error margin in a specific case ] // If the reserved period goes into the next year, and lasts until after the whole February, there is a possibility that price wont be calculated properly ( because of days in February )
        Returns:
        number of days in interval

        Returns:
